column4: hi can someone provide me with some help... ive recently installed some package updates via the update manager, but after rebooting my screen res dropped to 640x480, my monitor was recognized as a crt but it's an LCD also all my "windows" have no window border
how did you installed the graphic drivers you where using
maybe you had compiz enabled; now the driver does not work and hence compiz can not work either
it would be usefull to see the output of « grep EE /var/log/Xorg.0.log » and ~/.xsession-errors
:) now you can investigate the issue
it would be usefull to see the output of « grep EE /var/log/Xorg.0.log » and ~/.xsession-errors
no post the whole files. « pastebinit /var/log/Xorg.0.log » « pastebinit ~/.xsession-errors »
nothing wrong per se in the log ... except maybe No modes were requested; the default mode "nvidia-auto-select" <<<<< maybe that explains the low resolution/ bit depht
i will try to use nvidia-settings to configure the card « gksudo nvidia-settings »
save the new Xorg.conf (there is a button to do it)
